heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 26 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (210°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), outside temperature (up 3.7°C), and inside temperature (up 1.9°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 6%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 442.7m higher than yesterday, 366.8m higher than the past week, 138.8m higher than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 604m to 2320m and averaged 1494.5m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright intervals likely. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (92%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
